definition: absolutely true (idiom)/manifold/true from many points of view
thousand
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
authenticated/solid/firm/real/true

sentences.english: It is quit true that "nothing is ventured, nothing is gained".
sentences.chinese: “不入虎穴，焉得虎子”這句話說得千真萬確。

sentences.english: I'm gonna getcha. It's a matter of fact.
sentences.chinese: 我要得到你，這是千真萬確的。

sentences.english: I know it is true from you.
sentences.chinese: 從你身上，我知道這是千真萬確的。

sentences.english: HERODIAS: Thou knowest well that it is true.
sentences.chinese: 你心知肚明，那千真萬確。
珀利阿斯的預言千真萬確。

sentences.english: Have we really had a moment when warm spring waves surged through our heart?
sentences.chinese: 千真萬確地，我們有那麼一刻內心深處陡卷溫暖春潮？

sentences.english: It' true, lutefisk is more popular in the United States than in Norway.
sentences.chinese: 千真萬確，滷特非食在美國比在挪威更受歡迎。

sentences.english: I can attest to the absolute truth of his statement.
sentences.chinese: 我可以證實他的話是千真萬確的。

sentences.english: Freeman is dead right, of course.
sentences.chinese: 千真萬確，弗里曼是正確的。

sentences.english: I repeat that I recognize him perfectly.
sentences.chinese: 我再說一遍，我千真萬確地認識他。

sentences.english: I know, hard to believe, but true.
sentences.chinese: 儘管難以置信，但卻是千真萬確的。

sentences.english: We are in love, and it's true love, it's verifiable.
sentences.chinese: 我們是相愛的，千真萬確，天地可鑑。

sentences.english: “It’s true, young people wear old-fashioned hats, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “千真萬確，年輕人戴舊式帽子了，”他說。

definition: argumentative/quarrelsome
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to force someone to do something
to be at a loss for words/speechless
affectionate/an affectionate person
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
